result.execSummary:
The defendant Shafiullah Malyar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.
  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay total costs/fine/forfeiture at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing 1/15/18 or penalty of 11 days Huber for non payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shafiullah Malyar

records.addlTxt: Return of Notice of Hearing

Attorney Matthew H Huppertz in court.   Defendant Shafiullah Malyar did not appear.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's appearance was previously waived. Defendant has completed the deferred prosecution agreement. Prosecuting attorney moves to amend Counts 1 and 2 to Disorderly Conduct with the repeaters stricken, contrary to ordinance 13-102(c)(8), Waukesha County Ordinances. Court approves amendment. No contest plea entered.  

The Court Orders the Following: Count #1

Forfeiture: $267.50 

The Court Orders the Following: Count #2

Forfeiture: $267.50 

Total forfeiture to be paid at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing 1/15/18. Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 11 days in Huber.

Count 3 was prevously dismissed and read in.

Legal Clerk spoke with defense counsel Huppertz 11/29/17, who advised defendant has completed all the requirements of the deferred prosecution agreement.   **Reviewed by Judge Ramirez on 11/29/17 - Defendant's appearance at the review hearing on 12/4/17 is hereby waived.**

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Deferred Prosecution Agreement signed by all parties.  
Signed by Judge Ralph Ramirez on January 22, 2016.
Review hearing at 12-04-2017 08:30 am
Treatment letter and certificate of completion filed by the defendant.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Shafiullah Malyar in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  
Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Interpreter Kabra Amin appeared by phone.
Defendant pled guilty to Counts 1 and 2.  Court withholds finding of guilt and accepts the Deferred Prosecution Agreement signed by the parties. 
Count 3 is dismissed and read in to counts 1 and 2. 
Review hearing scheduled for December 4, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Interpreter Kabra called with apologies regarding missed court date.  She was not aware of a the time difference.  She is available for the next court date.
Plea hearing at 01-22-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant Shafiullah Malyar in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court tried to call Pashto interpreter Kobra Mommandi several times at the 2 phone numbers listed for this interpreter to no avail.  Court makes a record regarding the nonappearance of the interpreter.  Court will not take a plea without an interpreter.  Attorney Huppertz makes statements regarding the interpretations.  Court adjourns this matter.  Court to try to reschedule the interpreter to the next date.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Check Case scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on June 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Attorney Matthew Huppertz in court.   Defendant Shafiullah Malyar did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Becky Van Dam, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney appears by authorization.  Defendant will need a Farsi interpreter (defendant is from Afghanistan) when the matter goes to change of plea but not for the next hearing.  Defendant is working on getting into counseling.  Defense requests further proceedings date in about 45 days.  Hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on May 7, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with the victim listed in the complaint.   Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.

Defendant Shafiullah Malyar in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 09:30 am.
